page.title: 04Smallholdings, Leebotwood
page.content: Smallholdings in the area are mostly leased from the County Council but some are privately owned.The average size is 30 acres.A group of small- holdings beside the A.49 is identical and was originally built by the County Council to be leased to ex-servicemen returning after the Great War. Most smallholdings concentrate on dairy farming and calf-rearing for beef.A few goats are kept on one and another is run as a market garden selling flower and vegetable plants, vegetables,fruit and eggs.Poultry are kept but there are no battery systems The smallholdings are usually run by one family and are often used as step- ping stones to larger farms.Many of the smallholders have another job, indicating that they find it hard to obtain a high enough income from their farming activities alone.
